moves.5. Qc2 Bb7 6. a3 Bxc3+ 7. Qxc3 O-O 8. Bg: Alternative variation: 10. Nd2 Nbd7 11. f3 c5 12. e4 [is a more preferred line. However, e3 is good move as well]
moves.10... Nbd7 11. Bd3 c5 12. O-O Qc7: Alternative variation: 12... Rc8 13. b4 cxd4 14. Nxd4 d5
moves.13. Rac1 Rac8 14. b4: corrrectly opening up the position; white has the bishop.
moves.14... cxd4 15. Nxd4 a6 16. f3 d5 17. Bg3: putting the Black queen in the line of fire and giving the white squared bishp the strong h2 b8 diagonal.
moves.17... e5 18. Nf5 Rfe8 19. Qb2:
is good, but not as good as Qd2.
Alternative variation: 19. Qd2 [adds some pressure on the d pawn.] Qb8 20. cxd5 Rxc1 21. Rxc1 Nxd5 (21... Bxd5 [loses a pawn to] 22. Bxa6 Qa7 23. Qe2 $18) 22. Bc4 N7f6 23. e4 Nf4 24. Bxf4 exf4 25. Nd6 [ and white should not have a difficult time winning this.]
moves.20. Rfd1: white is clearly better here, because of his excellent piece coordination.
moves.20... dxc4 21. Bxc4 b5 22. Bb3 Rxc1: Alternative variation: 22... Rc7 23. Rxc7 Qxc7 24. Rc1 Qb6 [ is better for Black, but still is lost, especially after] 25. Qa2
moves.23. Qxc1 Nb6 24. Nd6: Alternative variation: 24. Qc5 Nfd7 25. Qc2 [threatening Nxh6! .] Kf8 26. Nd6
moves.24... Re7 25. Qc5 Bd5 26. Bxd5: Alternative variation: 26. Nf5 [keeping the tension, while attacking black's rook.] Rc7 27. Bxe5 Rxc5 28. Bxb8 Rc3 29. Ne7+ Kf8 30. Nxd5 Rxb3 31. Nxb6
moves.26... Nbxd5 27. e4: Alternative variation: 27. Ne4 Rd7 28. Qc6 [almost all of Black's pieces are under attack] Rd8 29. Nxf6+ Nxf6 30. Rxd8+ Qxd8 31. Bxe5
Alternative variation: 31. Kf2 [ white should aim for getting his king into the game soon.]
moves.31... Rd8 32. Kh2:
gives up some of white's advantage. This move makes it harder to bring white's king into the game.
Alternative variation: 32. Kf1 [gets the king closer into the game, unlike Kh2, which hinders the future activity of the king.]
moves.36... Qf6 37. Rd7:
throws the game away.
Alternative variation: 37. Qd7 Re6
